title: [SOLVED] 820-2796 - No Backlight
message: There is no image either!? Does it even chime?

title: [SOLVED] 820-2796 - No Backlight
message: No, i don't have nothing in the screen.

title: [SOLVED] 820-2796 - No Backlight
message: Check SMC_LID and if that is ok then you first have to try a known good working LCD assembly.

title: [SOLVED] 820-2796 - No Backlight
message:
Duke, SMC_LID (3.41V) is ok and i try two different LCD assembly.
Another advice?

title: [SOLVED] 820-2796 - No Backlight
message: You need 5V coming through U9000, check if enable signal is there.

title: [SOLVED] 820-2796 - No Backlight
message:
U9000

Pin 1 - LCD_IG_PWR_EN - 0v
Pin 2 - PP3V3_S5 - 3.30V
Pin 3 - PP3V3_S5 - 3.30v
Pin 4 - PP3V3_SW_LCD_UF - 0V
Pin 5 - PP3V3_SW_LCD_UF - 0V
Pin 6 - GND

title: [SOLVED] 820-2796 - No Backlight
message: if this is not chiming you have a much bigger problem. Are CPU & GPU vcore present? If the internal LCD is unplugged, can you get an image on external monitor?

title: [SOLVED] 820-2796 - No Backlight
message:
Louis, 
I tested it with external monitor and it worked perfectly.

title: [SOLVED] 820-2796 - No Backlight
message: Are you testing this with an A1370 assembly? What is resistance to GND on pin 1 of U9000?

title: [SOLVED] 820-2796 - No Backlight
message: Resistance to GND on pin 1 of U9000: 1.003

title: [SOLVED] 820-2796 - No Backlight
message: Yes, and my resistance to GND on pin 1 of U9000 is 1.003

title: [SOLVED] 820-2796 - No Backlight
message: What is 1.003? ohm, Kohm, Mohm, diode?

title: [SOLVED] 820-2796 - No Backlight
message: Mohm in diode mode

title: [SOLVED] 820-2796 - No Backlight
message: I have no idea what that means

title: [SOLVED] 820-2796 - No Backlight
message: Im not an engineer and I undestand 1.003 MΩ ( 1MΩ) :)

title: [SOLVED] 820-2796 - No Backlight
message:
[B]Sorry, Duke.
Resistance to GND on pin 1 of U9000: 1.005 Ohm (Ω)[/B]

title: [SOLVED] 820-2796 - No Backlight
message: That seems fine. What is the history on this board? Liquid?

title: [SOLVED] 820-2796 - No Backlight
message: no, it's not liquid damage. I just replaced the screen only. screen is good. but does not have video/back light. just sound and external video.

title: [SOLVED] 820-2796 - No Backlight
message: Was the screen replaced because it was cracked? How did this problem start?

title: [SOLVED] 820-2796 - No Backlight
message:
Yes. I replaced bc the screen is cracked.
I can't figure the problem.

I just order a new assembly.

title: [SOLVED] 820-2796 - No Backlight

both  assembly I installed earlier were bad ,  I installed New Assembly again and everything works fine now .  
Thank you Guys for all advice.

title: [SOLVED] 820-2796 - No Backlight
message:
[QUOTE="JorgePayar, post: 2741"]Im not an engineer and I undestand 1.003 MΩ ( 1MΩ) :)[/QUOTE]

Just want to make a request that we try to understand what we don't understand before we make comments like this. Not a huge deal, but let's be good students here. I'm gonna go ahead and posit that if dukefawks says it doesn't make sense, it probably doesn't make sense. Diode mode doesn't measure resistance, it measures voltage drop to ground if the positive lead is on ground.
